It is also used to refer to a contraction in a country's economy, which is reflected in a decrease in its gross domestic product (GDP) during any quarter of a given year. Negative growth is typically expressed as a negative percentage rate. KEY TAKEAWAYS Negative growth is a decline in a company's sales or earnings, or a decrease in an economy's GDP during any quarter. Declining wage growth and a contraction of the money supply are characteristics of negative growth, and economists view negative growth as a sign of a possible recession or depression.
